similar_terms_raw: extracellular structure organization (GO:0043062); extracellular matrix organization (GO:0030198); collagen fibril organization (GO:0030199); negative regulation of cell-matrix adhesion (GO:0001953)
novel_aspects: **Identifies specific ECM-remodeling mechanisms:** SERPINE1-PAI1 plasminogen activation axis; ANXA2 membrane repair and integrin stabilization; POSTN-integrin bidirectional signaling. GSEA only identifies structural terms; DeepSearch reveals active molecular mechanisms driving invasion and dispersal.

similar_terms_raw: regulation of MAP kinase activity (GO:0043405); negative regulation of Ras protein signal transduction (GO:0046580); negative regulation of small GTPase mediated signal transduction (GO:0051058)
novel_aspects: **Identifies dedicated stemness maintenance circuit:** WNT/LEF1 self-renewal axis independent of classical RTK signaling. DeepSearch locates transcriptional stemness factors; GSEA captures only downstream signaling consequences. **Mechanistic specificity:** LEF1 nuclear transcriptional function in maintaining GSC pools.

similar_terms_raw: extracellular matrix organization (GO:0030198); collagen fibril organization (GO:0030199); angiotensin-activated signaling pathway (GO:0038166); cellular response to angiotensin (GO:1904385); collagen-containing extracellular matrix (GO:0062023)
novel_aspects: **Identifies non-canonical angiogenic pathways:** ALK-Pleiotrophin axis; PDGFD-independent ANGPT1 Tie2 signaling (distinct from VEGFA); collagen-diversity effect suggesting specialized vascular niches. DeepSearch reveals redundancy and alternative angiogenic routes not captured by GO pathway annotations.

similar_terms_raw: regulation of neuronal synaptic plasticity (GO:0048168); regulation of neurotransmitter receptor activity (GO:0099601); synaptic membrane (GO:0097060); dendritic spine membrane (GO:0032591); synaptic vesicle membrane (GO:0030672)
novel_aspects: **Novel integration of bidirectional neuron-glioma synaptic communication:** DeepSearch identifies coordinated expression of presynaptic (CAMK2, GRM7), postsynaptic (GABBR2), and vesicular (SLC18A1) machinery in tumor cells—enabling exploitation of neuronal synapses for growth signals. **Mechanistic advance:** Reveals neurotensin (NTSR1) and GABAergic (GABBR2) crosstalk modulating stemness and invasion, a nexus not isolated by traditional GO analysis.

similar_terms_raw: regulation of MAP kinase activity (GO:0043405); regulation of neurotransmitter receptor activity (GO:0099601) *(indirect)*; endoplasmic reticulum lumen (GO:0005788); exocytic vesicle membrane (GO:0099501)
novel_aspects: **Identifies stress-response program distinct from classical signaling:** CA2/SLC4A4 pH buffering and metabolic adaptation; GDF15 paracrine/autocrine stress-induced apoptosis escape; TRIB3-mediated ER stress survival; RCAN1 calcineurin-dependent resilience. **Not explicitly in GSEA:** These genes define a metabolic-immune axis (HIF1A partners) regulating autophagy and therapeutic resistance.

myelination (GO:0042552), central nervous system myelination (GO:0022010), oligodendrocyte development (GO:0014003), axon ensheathment (GO:0032291), oligodendrocyte differentiation (GO:0048709), glial cell differentiation (GO:0010001)
novel_aspects: Integrated stemness programming; hijacking of lineage programs for immune evasion \& infiltration; interaction of transcription factors with myelin biosynthesis genes extends beyond differentiation alone.

similar_terms_raw: extracellular matrix organization (GO:0030198), extracellular structure organization (GO:0043062), external encapsulating structure organization (GO:0045229)
novel_aspects: Dynamic interplay of matrix proteases, collagen synthesis, and integrin/adhesion—explicit mechanistic impact on migration speed, matrix stiffness, and angiogenesis, not identified in standard GSEA.

similar_terms_raw: regulation of ion transport (GO:0043269), regulation of sodium ion transport (GO:0002028), cell junction organization (GO:0034330), cell-cell junction organization (GO:0045216), cell-cell junction (GO:0005911), Calcium signaling pathway
novel_aspects: Explicit appreciation of tumor-neuron synaptic integration, functional excitatory input to tumor, neuronally-driven proliferation and Akt activation, offering circuit-level insights not captured by high-level ion transport terms.

similar_terms_raw: negative regulation of axon extension (GO:0030517), negative regulation of axon extension in axon guidance (GO:0048843), neural crest cell migration (GO:0001755)
novel_aspects: Repurposing of developmental axon guidance molecules (semaphorins/plexins/NRP) for tumor migration along white matter tracts and perivascular spaces with directional context; direct cytoskeletal remodeling integration.

program_name: Neural Stem Cell Maintenance and Pluripotency
similar_terms_raw: central nervous system development (GO:0007417), neural crest cell development (GO:0014032), peripheral nervous system development (GO:0007422)
novel_aspects: Elucidation of Notch/bHLH/ERBB3 stemness pathway co-optation for self-renewal, therapy resistance, and GBM hierarchical organization, prioritizing pathway logic not just tissue development/differentiation.

program_name: Cell Cycle Proliferation and Checkpoint Dysregulation
similar_terms_raw: ameboidal-type cell migration (GO:0001667)
novel_aspects: Mechanistic connection between specific cell cycle accelerator genes, checkpoint evasion machinery, and therapy resistance; links to spindle dynamics and apoptosis repression, which GSEA terms do not resolve.
Coordination of glycosphingolipid synthesis, vesicular trafficking (SYT6/SYT7/ATP8A2), and membrane expansion for tumor growth and microtube formation—absent from general GSEA terms.

Integration of hypoxia-target genes (TF, CA10, DIO2, PTGDS) and HIF-driven angiogenesis/metabolic reprogramming in GBM, with therapy resistance and immunosuppression context not directly addressed by GSEA terms.
Explicit program describing autophagy and lysosomal pathways in GBM stress survival, chemotherapy resistance, and choice between autophagic survival and cell death, not reflected in GSEA terms.

program_name: Amino Acid Metabolism and Nutrient Transport
novel_aspects: Rewired glutaminolysis, amino acid transport (SLC7A14, SLC1A1), and nucleotide synthesis supporting metabolic flexibility, which is not captured by high-level transport or metabolism terms in the GSEA results.

program_name: DNA Damage Response and Genomic Stability
novel_aspects: Mechanistic annotation of DNA damage checkpoint, double-strand break repair, and therapy resistance involving direct protein effectors (CABLES1, ZNF536, SIRT2), missing from general GSEA terms.

similar_terms_raw: None
novel_aspects: Identifies lineage plasticity and astrocyte lineage transitions supported by neural activity genes (ARC, DAB1) not directly reflected in glycoprotein biosynthesis.

similar_terms_raw: glycoprotein biosynthetic process (GO:0009101)
novel_aspects: Explicitly details cell-matrix adhesion via integrins (ITGB4), CD44, metalloproteinases (ADAMTS5), ECM proteins, and pro-migratory lipid signaling (PLA2G4A).

similar_terms_raw: None
novel_aspects: Links SLC7A11 (xCT) and LUCAT1 to ROS/ferroptosis resistance and metabolic adaptation, a program not captured by glycoprotein biosynthetic process.

program_name: Immune evasion: MHC class I downregulation
similar_terms_raw: None
novel_aspects: Focuses on NLRC5-mediated antigen presentation and immune evasion, an axis not covered by glycoprotein synthesis.

similar_terms_raw: cilium movement (GO:0003341), regulation of cilium movement (GO:0003352), axonemal dynein complex assembly (GO:0070286), cilium organization (GO:0044782), cilium assembly (GO:0060271), axoneme assembly (GO:0035082), inner dynein arm assembly (GO:0036159), motile cilium (GO:0031514), cilium (GO:0005929), regulation of microtubule motor activity (GO:2000574), plasma membrane bounded cell projection assembly (GO:0120031)
novel_aspects: DeepSearch links ciliary genes not only to movement, assembly and axoneme but interprets their co-expression as dedifferentiation, developmental reactivation, or stem-like programs in glioblastoma, which is not captured in standard enrichment outputs. Also, the role of ciliary genes in Hedgehog/GLI signaling and cancer cell signaling is highlighted as a program-level impact.

similar_terms_raw: extracellular matrix organization (GO:0030198), collagen fibril organization (GO:0030199), collagen-containing extracellular matrix (GO:0062023)
novel_aspects: DeepSearch recovery matches GSEA, but it provides mechanistic connections (e.g., THBS1 at invasive borders, immunosuppressive ECM signatures, resistance to anti-angiogenic therapy, and specific links between ECM genes and tumor microenvironment). Examples such as HMCN1 mutation prevalence, the mesenchymal signature, and EMT induction in glioma are not explicit in GO terms.

similar_terms_raw: Glutamatergic synapse
novel_aspects: DeepSearch goes beyond synaptic annotation to describe neuron-glioma synapse formation and the role of GABAergic signaling and chloride transporters (e.g., depolarization vs inhibition), with links to proliferation and clinical relevance in glioblastoma. GSEA provides only general synapse association.

similar_terms_raw: (none)
novel_aspects: No direct matching GSEA terms in the provided GO list. DeepSearch uncovers programs related to ZNF, PLAGL1, CHD5, PRMT8, and AFF2 action in differentiation, stemness, edge-to-core transition, and tumor suppression. Also describes specific mechanistic aspects such as Hedgehog pathway modulation via ZNF521, chromatin organization, CD109 regulation, and PRMT8-driven neuronal differentiation.

similar_terms_raw: (none)
novel_aspects: No direct matching GSEA terms. DeepSearch interprets ADCY8, KSR2, MAP3K19, MAP7 as a coordinated signaling/metabolic module relevant for sex-specific risk, energy homeostasis, chemoresistance, and mirroring mesenchymal GBM biology, which GSEA does not identify.

similar_terms_raw: (none)
novel_aspects: No direct matches in GSEA. DeepSearch describes specific links to NRG3/BMP6 in invasion, glioma stem cell quiescence, immune infiltration, and radioresistance. Provides pathway-level understanding absent in GO enrichment alone.

similar_terms_raw: (none)
novel_aspects: No direct matches in GO terms. DeepSearch flags drug and metabolite transporters as relevant to stemness, therapy response, and tumor metabolism, which are not highlighted by GSEA, and gives specific genes.

similar_terms_raw: (none)
novel_aspects: No direct matches in GO terms. DeepSearch identifies B cell and cytokine signaling features (BANK1, FYB2, IL6R) and links to immune infiltration, lymphoid structure formation, and clinical prediction, absent from GO enrichment.

similar_terms_raw: collagen-containing extracellular matrix (GO:0062023), catenin complex (GO:0016342)
novel_aspects: Connects ECM gene activation to angiogenesis, invasion, and therapy resistance; specifically highlights FAP, POSTN, and pathway-level roles in progression[^2_1][^2_2][^2_3][^2_4][^2_5][^2_6]

similar_terms_raw: synaptic vesicle membrane (GO:0030672), exocytic vesicle membrane (GO:0099501), ionotropic glutamate receptor complex (GO:0008328), excitatory synapse (GO:0060076)

program_name: Glioma Stem Cell Maintenance and Therapy Resistance
similar_terms_raw: None (no direct GO term match)
novel_aspects: Identifies GFRA1, GREM2, RUNX1T1, MYT1L, and transcription factors as central to stemness, self-renewal, and chemoresistance in GBM microenvironment (roles not annotated or rarely linked in GSEA) [^2_13][^2_14][^2_15]

similar_terms_raw: cellular water homeostasis (GO:0009992), integral component of plasma membrane (GO:0005887)
novel_aspects: Direct link between AQP1, AQP4, KCNN3 and enhanced invasion/edema in glioblastoma; migratory strategy supported by aquaporins/ion channels, not captured explicitly by GSEA

similar_terms_raw: none directly; partial overlap with "integral component of plasma membrane" (GO:0005887) due to astrocyte markers
novel_aspects: Evidence for astrocytic and stemness markers inducing GBM invasiveness/therapy resistance, stemness maintenance via ID3/ID4/CD44 not reflected in GSEA

similar_terms_raw: extracellular structure organization (GO:0043062), external encapsulating structure organization (GO:0045229), extracellular matrix organization (GO:0030198), collagen-containing extracellular matrix (GO:0062023)
novel_aspects: More detailed mechanistic understanding: invasion via HAS2, BCAN, TIMP3, ADAMTS proteins; emphasis on hyaluronan synthesis pathway and non-collagen ECM remodeling, direct links to cell adhesion/integrin signaling

novel_aspects: Connects F3, EGF, PDGFRB, EDNRA, EDNRB to integrated vascular remodeling and resistance mechanisms (not explicitly captured by GO: terms); focuses on neovascularization and antiangiogenic therapy resistance

similar_terms_raw: Complement and coagulation cascades (for C3, F3), negative regulation of endopeptidase and peptidase activity (GO:0010951, GO:0010466) in broad sense
novel_aspects: DeepSearch highlights immune suppression and adaptation via SERPINA3, C3, CHI3L2, including hypoxia-driven complement regulation and microenvironment adaptation, which is not a distinct GSEA term

similar_terms_raw: None matched directly

novel_aspects: Precise identification of PRRX1, RELN, FREM2, STC1 in driving EMT-like mesenchymal transition and ECM remodeling; these gene/process links are not discernible in GSEA terms focused on axon/neuronal development [^2_7][^2_8]

similar_terms_raw: None matched directly
novel_aspects: Direct assignment of LGALS1, ISG15 roles in local immunosuppression and therapy escape, which GSEA overlooks [^2_9][^2_10]

similar_terms_raw: microtubule cytoskeleton organization in mitosis, mitotic spindle organization, mitotic sister chromatid segregation, sister chromatid segregation, mitotic nuclear division, mitotic metaphase plate congression, regulation of cytokinesis, mitotic cytokinesis, cytoskeleton-dependent cytokinesis, mitotic cell cycle phase transition, regulation of mitotic cell cycle phase transition, mitotic spindle assembly, kinetochore organization, mitotic spindle checkpoint signaling, spindle assembly checkpoint signaling, chromosome condensation, chromosome organization, and more.

program_name: Cell Cycle Progression and DNA Replication
similar_terms_raw: regulation of cell cycle process, positive regulation of cell cycle process, regulation of cell cycle, cell cycle checkpoint signaling, positive regulation of cell division, DNA replication, regulation of cyclin-dependent protein kinase activity, mitotic chromosome condensation, DNA repair, G2/M transition, regulation of signal transduction by p53, and more.
novel_aspects: Integrates DNA replication/repair machinery with cell cycle control, linking RRM2, BRIP1, EXO1, and POLQ to therapy resistance and replicative stress in glioblastoma; explicitly associates the BRCA1-FANCD2 axis with tumorigenicity and identifies repair-dependent resistance mechanisms not emphasized in standard GSEA output.

similar_terms_raw: Not directly reflected; closest: regulation of cell population proliferation, positive regulation of cell cycle process, regulation of multicellular organismal development.
novel_aspects: Identification of HMMR, MKI67, MELK, ASPM, FOXM1 stemness modules driving glioblastoma self-renewal, recurrence, and resistance. Pinpoints glioma stem cell biology, regulatory axes, and connection to poor prognosis; links MELK-FOXM1 axis and stemness signatures as central features omitted by classical GSEA.
